availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse J. Craddock (Hart County, KY, farmer and lieutenant colonel)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Craddock. Farmer in Hart County in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and major from October 4, 1861, to January 26, 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Capital Guards (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel from July 7, 1864, to September 4, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 176B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 68.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 754.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0016.
